Lily had always taken pride in her appearance, but lately, she had been noticing some concerning changes in her nails. They seemed thinner, more brittle, and even discolored in some areas. As a busy professional, she often found herself rushing through her manicures, skipping the essential steps that kept her nails looking their best.

One day, as Lily was browsing through her favorite beauty magazine, an article on nail health caught her eye. The article highlighted the importance of proper nail care and the role that certain supplements could play in promoting stronger, healthier nails. Intrigued, Lily decided to take a closer look.

### Understanding Nail Structure and Growth

The article explained that nails are composed of a hard protein called keratin, which is produced by specialized cells at the base of the nail. This keratin is what gives nails their strength and resilience. However, factors like poor diet, stress, and environmental exposures can affect the quality and growth of this keratin, leading to brittle, discolored, or even fungal nails.

Lily nodded as she read, realizing that her own hectic lifestyle and occasional neglect of her nail care routine might have contributed to the changes she was seeing. She was determined to make a change and get her nails back to their former glory.
